intro: Tetracera asiatica subsp. andamanica, commonly known as the Andaman tetracera, is a flowering plant native to the Andaman and Nicobar Islands. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually yellowish-green, and it produces capsule fruits that contain several seeds. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution.
